__array_namespace_info__.description: Returns a namespace with Array API namespace inspection utilities.

__eq__.description: Computes the truth value of ``self == other`` in order to test for data type object equality.

abs.description: Calculates the absolute value for each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x``.

acos.description: Calculates an implementation-dependent approximation of the principal value of the inverse cosine for each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x``.

acosh.description: Calculates an implementation-dependent approximation to the inverse hyperbolic cosine for each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x``.

add.description: Calculates the sum for each element ``x1_i`` of the input array ``x1`` with the respective element ``x2_i`` of the input array ``x2``.

all.description: Tests whether all input array elements evaluate to ``True`` along a specified axis.

any.description: Tests whether any input array element evaluates to ``True`` along a specified axis.

arange.description: Returns evenly spaced values within the half-open interval ``[start, stop)`` as a one-dimensional array.

argmax.description: Returns the indices of the maximum values along a specified axis.

argmin.description: Returns the indices of the minimum values along a specified axis.

argsort.description: Returns the indices that sort an array ``x`` along a specified axis.

asarray.description: Convert the input to an array.
std_args: Union[array, bool, int, float, complex, NestedSequence, SupportsBufferProtocol]

asin.description: Calculates an implementation-dependent approximation of the principal value of the inverse sine for each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x``.

asinh.description: Calculates an implementation-dependent approximation to the inverse hyperbolic sine for each element ``x_i`` in the input array ``x``.

astype.description: Copies an array to a specified data type irrespective of :ref:`type-promotion` rules.

atan.description: Calculates an implementation-dependent approximation of the principal value of the inverse tangent for each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x``.

atan2.description: Calculates an implementation-dependent approximation of the inverse tangent of the quotient ``x1/x2``, having domain ``[-infinity, +infinity] x [-infinity, +infinity]`` (where the ``x`` notation denotes the set of ordered pairs of elements ``(x1_i, x2_i)``) and codomain ``[-π, +π]``, for each pair of elements ``(x1_i, x2_i)`` of the input arrays ``x1`` and ``x2``, respectively. Each element-wise result is expressed in radians.

atanh.description: Calculates an implementation-dependent approximation to the inverse hyperbolic tangent for each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x``.

bitwise_and.description: Computes the bitwise AND of the underlying binary representation of each element ``x1_i`` of the input array ``x1`` with the respective element ``x2_i`` of the input array ``x2``.

bitwise_invert.description: Inverts (flips) each bit for each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x``.

bitwise_left_shift.description: Shifts the bits of each element ``x1_i`` of the input array ``x1`` to the left by appending ``x2_i`` (i.e., the respective element in the input array ``x2``) zeros to the right of ``x1_i``.

bitwise_or.description: Computes the bitwise OR of the underlying binary representation of each element ``x1_i`` of the input array ``x1`` with the respective element ``x2_i`` of the input array ``x2``.

bitwise_right_shift.description: Shifts the bits of each element ``x1_i`` of the input array ``x1`` to the right according to the respective element ``x2_i`` of the input array ``x2``.

bitwise_xor.description: Computes the bitwise XOR of the underlying binary representation of each element ``x1_i`` of the input array ``x1`` with the respective element ``x2_i`` of the input array ``x2``.

broadcast_arrays.description: Broadcasts one or more arrays against one another.

broadcast_to.description: Broadcasts an array to a specified shape.

can_cast.description: Determines if one data type can be cast to another data type according to type promotion rules (see :ref:`type-promotion`).

capabilities.description: Returns a dictionary of array library capabilities.

ceil.description: Rounds each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x`` to the smallest (i.e., closest to ``-infinity``) integer-valued number that is not less than ``x_i``.

cholesky.description: Returns the lower (upper) Cholesky decomposition of a complex Hermitian or real symmetric positive-definite matrix ``x``.

clip.description: Clamps each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x`` to the range ``[min, max]``.

concat.description: Joins a sequence of arrays along an existing axis.

conj.description: Returns the complex conjugate for each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x``.

copysign.description: Composes a floating-point value with the magnitude of ``x1_i`` and the sign of ``x2_i`` for each element of the input array ``x1``.

cos.description: Calculates an implementation-dependent approximation to the cosine for each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x``.

cosh.description: Calculates an implementation-dependent approximation to the hyperbolic cosine for each element ``x_i`` in the input array ``x``.

count_nonzero.description: Counts the number of array elements which are non-zero.

cross.description: Returns the cross product of 3-element vectors.

cumulative_prod.description: Calculates the cumulative product of elements in the input array ``x``.

cumulative_sum.description: Calculates the cumulative sum of elements in the input array ``x``.

default_dtypes.description: Returns a dictionary containing default data types.

det.description: Returns the determinant of a square matrix (or a stack of square matrices) ``x``.

devices.description: Returns a list of supported devices which are available at runtime.

diagonal.description: Returns the specified diagonals of a matrix (or a stack of matrices) ``x``.

diff.description: Calculates the n-th discrete forward difference along a specified axis.

divide.description: Calculates the division of each element ``x1_i`` of the input array ``x1`` with the respective element ``x2_i`` of the input array ``x2``.

dtypes.description: Returns a dictionary of supported *Array API* data types.

e.description: IEEE 754 floating-point representation of Euler's constant.

eigh.description: Returns an eigenvalue decomposition of a complex Hermitian or real symmetric matrix (or a stack of matrices) ``x``.

eigvalsh.description: Returns the eigenvalues of a complex Hermitian or real symmetric matrix (or a stack of matrices) ``x``.

empty.description: Returns an uninitialized array having a specified `shape`.

empty_like.description: Returns an uninitialized array with the same ``shape`` as an input array ``x``.

equal.description: Computes the truth value of ``x1_i == x2_i`` for each element ``x1_i`` of the input array ``x1`` with the respective element ``x2_i`` of the input array ``x2``.

exp.description: Calculates an implementation-dependent approximation to the exponential function for each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x`` (``e`` raised to the power of ``x_i``, where ``e`` is the base of the natural logarithm).

expand_dims.description: Expands the shape of an array by inserting a new axis (dimension) of size one at the position specified by ``axis``.

expm1.description: Calculates an implementation-dependent approximation to ``exp(x)-1`` for each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x``.

eye.description: Returns a two-dimensional array with ones on the ``k``\th diagonal and zeros elsewhere.

fft.description: Computes the one-dimensional discrete Fourier transform.

fftfreq.description: Computes the discrete Fourier transform sample frequencies.

fftn.description: Computes the n-dimensional discrete Fourier transform.

fftshift.description: Shifts the zero-frequency component to the center of the spectrum.

finfo.description: Machine limits for floating-point data types.

flip.description: Reverses the order of elements in an array along the given axis. The shape of the array must be preserved.

floor.description: Rounds each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x`` to the greatest (i.e., closest to ``+infinity``) integer-valued number that is not greater than ``x_i``.

floor_divide.description: Rounds the result of dividing each element ``x1_i`` of the input array ``x1`` by the respective element ``x2_i`` of the input array ``x2`` to the greatest (i.e., closest to `+infinity`) integer-value number that is not greater than the division result.

from_dlpack.description: Returns a new array containing the data from another (array) object with a ``__dlpack__`` method.

full.description: Returns a new array having a specified ``shape`` and filled with ``fill_value``.

full_like.description: Returns a new array filled with ``fill_value`` and having the same ``shape`` as an input array ``x``.

greater.description: Computes the truth value of ``x1_i > x2_i`` for each element ``x1_i`` of the input array ``x1`` with the respective element ``x2_i`` of the input array ``x2``.

greater_equal.description: Computes the truth value of ``x1_i >= x2_i`` for each element ``x1_i`` of the input array ``x1`` with the respective element ``x2_i`` of the input array ``x2``.

hfft.description: Computes the one-dimensional discrete Fourier transform of a signal with Hermitian symmetry.

hypot.description: Computes the square root of the sum of squares for each element ``x1_i`` of the input array ``x1`` with the respective element ``x2_i`` of the input array ``x2``.

ifft.description: Computes the one-dimensional inverse discrete Fourier transform.

ifftn.description: Computes the n-dimensional inverse discrete Fourier transform.

ihfft.description: Computes the one-dimensional inverse discrete Fourier transform of a signal with Hermitian symmetry.

iinfo.description: Machine limits for integer data types.

imag.description: Returns the imaginary component of a complex number for each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x``.

inv.description: Returns the multiplicative inverse of a square matrix (or a stack of square matrices) ``x``.

irfft.description: Computes the one-dimensional inverse of ``rfft`` for complex-valued input.

irfftn.description: Computes the n-dimensional inverse of ``rfftn`` for complex-valued input.

isdtype.description: Returns a boolean indicating whether a provided dtype is of a specified data type "kind".

isfinite.description: Tests each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x`` to determine if finite.

isinf.description: Tests each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x`` to determine if equal to positive or negative infinity.

isnan.description: Tests each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x`` to determine whether the element is ``NaN``.

less.description: Computes the truth value of ``x1_i < x2_i`` for each element ``x1_i`` of the input array ``x1`` with the respective element ``x2_i`` of the input array ``x2``.

less_equal.description: Computes the truth value of ``x1_i <= x2_i`` for each element ``x1_i`` of the input array ``x1`` with the respective element ``x2_i`` of the input array ``x2``.

linspace.description: Returns evenly spaced numbers over a specified interval.

log.description: Calculates an implementation-dependent approximation to the natural (base ``e``) logarithm for each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x``.

log10.description: Calculates an implementation-dependent approximation to the base ``10`` logarithm for each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x``.

log1p.description: Calculates an implementation-dependent approximation to ``log(1+x)``, where ``log`` refers to the natural (base ``e``) logarithm, for each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x``.

log2.description: Calculates an implementation-dependent approximation to the base ``2`` logarithm for each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x``.

logaddexp.description: Calculates the logarithm of the sum of exponentiations ``log(exp(x1) + exp(x2))`` for each element ``x1_i`` of the input array ``x1`` with the respective element ``x2_i`` of the input array ``x2``.

logical_and.description: Computes the logical AND for each element ``x1_i`` of the input array ``x1`` with the respective element ``x2_i`` of the input array ``x2``.

logical_not.description: Computes the logical NOT for each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x``.

logical_or.description: Computes the logical OR for each element ``x1_i`` of the input array ``x1`` with the respective element ``x2_i`` of the input array ``x2``.

logical_xor.description: Computes the logical XOR for each element ``x1_i`` of the input array ``x1`` with the respective element ``x2_i`` of the input array ``x2``.

matrix_norm.description: Computes the matrix norm of a matrix (or a stack of matrices) ``x``.
std_args: Optional[Union[int, float, Literal[inf, Any, fro, nuc]]]

matrix_power.description: Raises a square matrix (or a stack of square matrices) ``x`` to an integer power ``n``.

matrix_rank.description: Returns the rank (i.e., number of non-zero singular values) of a matrix (or a stack of matrices).

max.description: Calculates the maximum value of the input array ``x``.

maximum.description: Computes the maximum value for each element ``x1_i`` of the input array ``x1`` relative to the respective element ``x2_i`` of the input array ``x2``.

mean.description: Calculates the arithmetic mean of the input array ``x``.

meshgrid.description: Returns coordinate matrices from coordinate vectors.

min.description: Calculates the minimum value of the input array ``x``.

minimum.description: Computes the minimum value for each element ``x1_i`` of the input array ``x1`` relative to the respective element ``x2_i`` of the input array ``x2``.

moveaxis.description: Moves array axes (dimensions) to new positions, while leaving other axes in their original positions.

multiply.description: Calculates the product for each element ``x1_i`` of the input array ``x1`` with the respective element ``x2_i`` of the input array ``x2``.

nan.description: IEEE 754 floating-point representation of Not a Number (``NaN``).

negative.description: Computes the numerical negative of each element ``x_i`` (i.e., ``y_i = -x_i``) of the input array ``x``.

newaxis.description: An alias for ``None`` which is useful for indexing arrays.

nextafter.description: Returns the next representable floating-point value for each element ``x1_i`` of the input array ``x1`` in the direction of the respective element ``x2_i`` of the input array ``x2``.

nonzero.description: Returns the indices of the array elements which are non-zero.

not_equal.description: Computes the truth value of ``x1_i != x2_i`` for each element ``x1_i`` of the input array ``x1`` with the respective element ``x2_i`` of the input array ``x2``.

ones.description: Returns a new array having a specified ``shape`` and filled with ones.

ones_like.description: Returns a new array filled with ones and having the same ``shape`` as an input array ``x``.

outer.description: Returns the outer product of two vectors ``x1`` and ``x2``.

permute_dims.description: Permutes the axes (dimensions) of an array ``x``.

pi.description: IEEE 754 floating-point representation of the mathematical constant ``π``.

pinv.description: Returns the (Moore-Penrose) pseudo-inverse of a matrix (or a stack of matrices) ``x``.

positive.description: Computes the numerical positive of each element ``x_i`` (i.e., ``y_i = +x_i``) of the input array ``x``.

pow.description: Calculates an implementation-dependent approximation of exponentiation by raising each element ``x1_i`` (the base) of the input array ``x1`` to the power of ``x2_i`` (the exponent), where ``x2_i`` is the corresponding element of the input array ``x2``.

prod.description: Calculates the product of input array ``x`` elements.

qr.description: Returns the QR decomposition of a full column rank matrix (or a stack of matrices).

real.description: Returns the real component of a complex number for each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x``.

reciprocal.description: Returns the reciprocal for each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x``.

remainder.description: Returns the remainder of division for each element ``x1_i`` of the input array ``x1`` and the respective element ``x2_i`` of the input array ``x2``.

repeat.description: Repeats each element of an array a specified number of times on a per-element basis.

reshape.description: Reshapes an array without changing its data.

result_type.description: Returns the dtype that results from applying type promotion rules (see :ref:`type-promotion`) to the arguments.

rfft.description: Computes the one-dimensional discrete Fourier transform for real-valued input.

rfftfreq.description: Computes the discrete Fourier transform sample frequencies (for ``rfft`` and ``irfft``).

rfftn.description: Computes the n-dimensional discrete Fourier transform for real-valued input.

roll.description: Rolls array elements along a specified axis. Array elements that roll beyond the last position are re-introduced at the first position. Array elements that roll beyond the first position are re-introduced at the last position.

round.description: Rounds each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x`` to the nearest integer-valued number.

searchsorted.description: Finds the indices into ``x1`` such that, if the corresponding elements in ``x2`` were inserted before the indices, the order of ``x1``, when sorted in ascending order, would be preserved.

sign.description: Returns an indication of the sign of a number for each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x``.

signbit.description: Determines whether the sign bit is set for each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x``.

sin.description: Calculates an implementation-dependent approximation to the sine for each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x``.

sinh.description: Calculates an implementation-dependent approximation to the hyperbolic sine for each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x``.

slogdet.description: Returns the sign and the natural logarithm of the absolute value of the determinant of a square matrix (or a stack of square matrices) ``x``.

solve.description: Returns the solution of a square system of linear equations with a unique solution.

sort.description: Returns a sorted copy of an input array ``x``.

sqrt.description: Calculates the principal square root for each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x``.

square.description: Squares each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x``.

stack.description: Joins a sequence of arrays along a new axis.

std.description: Calculates the standard deviation of the input array ``x``.

subtract.description: Calculates the difference for each element ``x1_i`` of the input array ``x1`` with the respective element ``x2_i`` of the input array ``x2``.

sum.description: Calculates the sum of the input array ``x``.

svd.description: Returns a singular value decomposition (SVD) of a matrix (or a stack of matrices) ``x``.

svdvals.description: Returns the singular values of a matrix (or a stack of matrices) ``x``.

take.description: Returns elements of an array along an axis.

take_along_axis.description: Returns elements from an array at the one-dimensional indices specified by ``indices`` along a provided ``axis``.

tan.description: Calculates an implementation-dependent approximation to the tangent for each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x``.

tanh.description: Calculates an implementation-dependent approximation to the hyperbolic tangent for each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x``.

tile.description: Constructs an array by tiling an input array.

trace.description: Returns the sum along the specified diagonals of a matrix (or a stack of matrices) ``x``.

tril.description: Returns the lower triangular part of a matrix (or a stack of matrices) ``x``.

triu.description: Returns the upper triangular part of a matrix (or a stack of matrices) ``x``.

trunc.description: Rounds each element ``x_i`` of the input array ``x`` to the nearest integer-valued number that is closer to zero than ``x_i``.

unique_all.description: Returns the unique elements of an input array ``x``, the first occurring indices for each unique element in ``x``, the indices from the set of unique elements that reconstruct ``x``, and the corresponding counts for each unique element in ``x``.

unique_counts.description: Returns the unique elements of an input array ``x`` and the corresponding counts for each unique element in ``x``.

unique_inverse.description: Returns the unique elements of an input array ``x`` and the indices from the set of unique elements that reconstruct ``x``.

unique_values.description: Returns the unique elements of an input array ``x``.

unstack.description: Splits an array into a sequence of arrays along the given axis.

var.description: Calculates the variance of the input array ``x``.

vector_norm.description: Computes the vector norm of a vector (or batch of vectors) ``x``.

where.description: Returns elements chosen from ``x1`` or ``x2`` depending on ``condition``.

zeros.description: Returns a new array having a specified ``shape`` and filled with zeros.

zeros_like.description: Returns a new array filled with zeros and having the same ``shape`` as an input array ``x``.
